body.p: Normally the toolbars are located under the menus. However, they can be moved to other positions, torn off or even hidden. All the commands performed through the toolbar buttons can also be performed through the Menu bar.

ul.li:
To display/hide a toolbar, check/uncheck the View Toolbars
<TOOLBAR NAME>
menu item.

li.p: To change the position of a toolbar, click and drag it.

body.p: The toolbars may differ depending on whether there is an opened document or not as well as on the type of the opened document and the authoring mode.
The possible toolbars are as follows:

ul.li: Document Toolbar lets you create/open/save/print/publish documents, undo/redo operations, cut/copy/paste, find&replace, check spelling, revalidate documents, call up help documentation and element help.
XSLT Parameters Toolbar lets you switch XSLT Parameter Sets.
Element Toolbar lets you insert/rename/split/join elements and edit elements' attributes.
Insert Toolbar lets you insert internal and external entities, symbols, XInclude, comments and processing instructions.
Zoom Toolbar lets you zoom documents.
Custom Content Toolbar lets you create, edit and insert custom content.
Table Toolbar lets you create and edit tables.
